turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Victoria Bridge, Brisbane.
turn.1: When was the Victoria Bridge built?
turn.2: A new crossing, opened on 15 June 1874 by the Governor of Queensland, the George Phipps, 2nd Marquess of Normanby, was an iron structure and a toll bridge.
turn.3: Who was the Victoria Bridge built for?
turn.4: The bridge was paid for by significant council borrowings that were to be recouped by tolls.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: However a lack of revenue forced its transfer to the Colonial Government.
turn.7: What did the government do with it?
turn.8: The tolls were abolished at this time.
turn.9: What else can you tell me about the Victoria Bridge?
turn.10: It included a turning span to allow tall masted river traffic to pass upstream.
turn.11: Was the Victoria Bridge ever taken down?
turn.12: The position of the swinging span was fixed when the tram-lines were laid along the bridge.
